metadata.title: CVE-2015-8543 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The networking implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.3.3, as used inAndroid and other products, does not validate protocol identifiers forcertain protocol families, which allows local users to cause a denial ofservice (NULL function pointer dereference and system crash) or possiblygain privileges by leveraging CLONE_NEWUSER support to execute a craftedSOCK_RAW application.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8543` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-4.4.0-2-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-2-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1012-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1012.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.4').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1012.12').
linux-aws package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
